contents.text: We FINALLY made a proper updater within Powercord, able to update more than just Powercord. It also does come with some new features, including the one you're looking at right now, **change logs**.
list: **Plugin and themes** will now be handled by the updater.
**Update conflicts** can now be solved within the UI, instead of telling you to do it manually.
**Updater interface got a redesign**, you should definitely check it out after reading this changelog.
**You can now decide to completely skip an update**, and disable specific ones. There is also a button that lets you pause updates until next reload.

contents.text: As some people already did notice, **we removed the beta tester badge and role** in our server. However if you feel too sad, you can [donate to Powercord](https://patreon.com/aetheryx) to customize your badges color ($1) or **get a customizable badge** ($5) for extra profile swag. There's always a solution to your problems.
Some small features that got added

list: **Added some error-handling** to the settings panels, it'll no longer make the whole settings page go blank if something goes wrong.
We rewrote some UIs to use Discord's internal components, so Powercord's settings panels should be **even more theme friendly**.
Some advanced features that require a restart now prompt you to restart Discord.
Announcements at the top of the window now shows from which plugin it's from, to prevent potential abuse.
Fixed a few broken components and added new pre-exported components for UI makers.
Fixed a bug where emma wasn't cute.

contents.text: There are a LOT of features we want to implement in Powercord, and here are a few of them that'll hopefully implement soon:
list: Functional plugin manager. You heard me right, this will happen!!1!
Style manager, with customization features without needing any JS because a theme that requires JS is gross.
A better user interface to manage [donor](https://patreon.com/aetheryx) features such as badges color and custom badge without having to ping a developer.
And of course, best features of all time: [your features](https://github.com/powercord-org/powercord/issues).
